title: ‘Repugnant’: US rebukes Israeli remark on Palestinian village
description: US State Department condemns Israeli minister's call for Huwara to be 'wiped out', calling it a 'disgusting' incitement.

title: TikTok sets new default time limits for minors
description: Changes arrive in the midst of growing concerns globally over the app's security and ability to push certain content.

title: Tunisia tennis star urges ‘dignity’ amid crackdown on immigrants
description: Ons Jabeur also shares on Twitter a picture of a Tunisian stamp from 1961 celebrating Africa Day.

title: Bola Tinubu is now Nigeria’s president-elect. What happens next?
description: The president-elect will need to bring together a divided country as he faces security and economic challenges.

title: Report finds no evidence foreign powers behind ‘Havana Syndrome’
description: Multiyear investigation by US agencies casts doubt on speculation that a hostile power was behind unexplained ailments.

title: Formula One drivers urged to speak up for human rights in Bahrain
description: Lewis Hamilton and other F1 drivers called upon by rights groups to speak up against human rights abuses in Bahrain.

title: Pakistan’s CPI soars to highest rate in nearly 50 years
description: Soaring food, beverage, transport costs push consumer price index to 31.5 percent in February, highest rate since 1974.

title: US drug maker to slash some insulin prices, expand cost cap
description: President Joe Biden hails move by Eli Lilly as a 'big deal', calling on other manufacturers to also reduce prices.

title: What’s behind the French leader’s visit to central Africa?
description: France has already announced it's scaling down its military presence on the African continent.

title: China, Belarus presidents call for establishing peace in Ukraine
description: Xi Jinping and Alexander Lukashenko call for the 'soonest possible' peace deal for Ukraine.

title: Reports on COVID origin reignite conspiracy theories about virus
description: FBI director, US Department of Energy say virus originated in a lab, but other US officials say there's no consensus.

title: Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot loses re-election bid
description: Lightfoot fails to qualify for runoff in mayoral race, where crime in the third largest US city was a top concern.

title: Analysis: Efforts to end Assad isolation gather speed after quake
description: Experts say many Arab governments see last month's earthquake disaster as reason to deepen engagement with al-Assad.

title: What explains mysterious poisonings of schoolgirls in Iran?
description: The persisting lack of clarity has led to wide-ranging speculation as to who is poisoning the students.

title: Did Ukraine start a drone war on Russia?
description: Several 'UFOs' have hovered above Russia in recent days, worrying pro-Kremlin figures.

title: Kobe Bryant’s family to get $28.5m from LA in photo case
description: Deal resolves claims related to first responders sharing photos of fatal helicopter crash that killed Bryant, 8 others.

title: Iran expels two Germany diplomats in tit-for-tat move
description: The months-long tensions between Tehran and Berlin reaches a new stage with both sides resorting to diplomatic action.

title: Why is Slovakia confiscating minority-owned property?
description: A World War II decree is used to take land from Hungarians and Germans in what amounts to collective punishment.

title: ‘You work like a dog but each month by the 10th your pay is gone’
description: A manicurist and her husband in Buenos Aires take on extra work where they can as living costs fluctuate and rise.

title: Israeli police fire stun grenades on pro-judiciary protests
description: Demonstrations are expected to intensify after what protest organisers dub a day of disruption.

title: Israel arrests settlers after anti-Palestinian ‘pogrom’
description: The Israeli military has been accused by Palestinians of standing by while settlers rampaged through villages this week.

title: Ride-hailing service app Careem ceases operations in Qatar
description: The announcement came in the form of an email sent to customers in Qatar on Monday.

title: Peru’s police arrest man carrying a mummy in food delivery bag
description: The mummy was in the isothermal bag the man had once used to deliver food to people's homes.

title: How an Albanian man traces his Bektashi roots
description: One man’s journey to discover his Bektashi roots reveals a religious order that suffered centuries of oppression.

title: Sudan police kill protester in anti-military demonstrations
description: Mazjoob is the 125th protester killed in weekly protests launched after the October 2021 coup.

title: New president of Vietnam nominated by Communist Party: Report
description: Vietnam's Communist Party has nominated Vo Van Thuong, 52, as the country's next president, according to sources.

title: Turkey’s Erdogan indicates election will take place on May 14
description: Last month's earthquakes led to suggestions that Turkey's parliamentary and presidential elections would be postponed.

title: India child marriage arrests leave families without breadwinner
description: Crackdown leaves poor families in Assam without main breadwinner as campaigners say arrests wrong way to tackle issue.

title: Sri Lanka workers defy strike ban to protest IMF bailout plan
description: President Ranil Wickremesinghe is facing a backlash over steep tax hikes and spending cuts imposed to get IMF funding.

title: Tropical Cyclone Judy hits Vanuatu, with another on its way
description: Storm uproots trees and forces evacuations with power cuts reported in the Pacific island nation's capital.

title: Swapping kabsa for kale: Saudis embrace healthy eating
description: The Saudi government is leading an effort to reduce obesity levels in the kingdom, with one in five Saudi adults obese.

title: Photos: Tinubu, supporters celebrate Nigeria election win
description: Election officials declared governing party candidate Bola Tinubu the winner of Nigeria's presidential election.

title: Taiwan says 19 Chinese fighter jets entered its air defence zone
description: A total of 25 Chinese warplanes and three warships were monitored operating off the Taiwanese coast.

title: Ukraine war important point of discussion at G20 meet, says India
description: Indian officials hope the meeting, also being held amid US-China tensions, will not overlook food and climate security.

title: Who is Bola Tinubu, Nigeria’s president-elect?
description: The 70-year-old has won the presidency of Africa's most populous nation with 8.8 million votes.

title: Who is Bolo Tinubu, Nigeria’s president-elect?
description: The 70-year-old has won the presidency of Africa's most populous nation with 8.8 million votes.

title: A year into Ukraine war, food prices rise and aid drops in Niger
description: Effects of the war are still being felt in one of the world’s poorest countries as inflated prices eat into budgets.

title: Photos: Deadly train collision in Greece kills dozens
description: Multiple train cars derailed and at least three burst into flames after the collision near the town of Tempe.

title: Pakistan top court orders polls in two provinces within 90 days
description: Supreme Court says elections for provincial assemblies in Punjab and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa must be held within 90 days.

title: FBI director says China laboratory leak was likely COVID source
description: FBI Director Christopher Wray accuses China of thwarting efforts to identify the origin of the COVID-19 outbreak.

title: International concern as conflict grows in breakaway Somaliland
description: Six countries issue joint statement over clashes around town of Lascanood between Somaliland and local clan forces.

title: Bola Tinubu wins controversial Nigerian presidential election
description: Tinubu, national leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC), has won the popular vote in the disputed election.

title: New US House committee on China cites ‘existential struggle’
description: New committee's efforts to counter Beijing are likely to put pressure on US President Joe Biden to take a firmer line.

title: China’s factory output smashes forecasts with decade-high growth
description: Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index hits its highest reading since 2012 after Beijing's lifting of COVID curbs.

title: A Bali island was full of rubbish. Residents made cleaning up pay
description: Community-run recycling centre is being credited with transforming Nusa Lembongan's once-polluted beaches and waterways.

title: Can climate lawsuits force Big Oil to change its ways?
description: As corporations fail to deliver on climate pledges, environmentalists turn to litigation.

title: Modi govt allowed Adani coal deals it knew were ‘Inappropriate’
description: The Modi govt brought in laws that helped the Adani Group keep its 'coal-scam era' deals.

title: At least 16 killed, dozens injured in Greece train crash
description: Rescue effort under way after passenger train carrying 350 people collided with a cargo train near city of Larissa.

title: Myanmar military gets new aviation fuel supplies despite abuses
description: New report from Amnesty Intl, Global Witness and Burma Campaign UK reveals new shipments of fuel despite air raids.

title: White House says it’s open to tighter restrictions on TikTok
description: Remarks come as legislation to ban the Chinese-owned app in the United States is making its way through Congress.

title: For some Chinese women it ‘doesn’t make sense’  to have babies
description: Top-down policy initiatives fail to account for a society whose attitudes towards women have changed little over time.

title: Rupert Murdoch says Fox TV hosts ‘endorsed’ false election claims
description: Murdoch's testimony has been unsealed as part of a defamation lawsuit brought by a US-based voting machine company.

title: US govt to chip makers: Share profits if you want subsidies
description: The plan requires firms that want subsidies to share future profits with government and provide childcare for employees.

title: Dozens of forest fires scorch Cuba, threatening brittle economy
description: An estimated 80 wildfires have struck the country since January, with blazes approaching the populous Santiago de Cuba.
